thag21.1:63.3: _Kāmakāro_: “wish-granter”. Ordinary people cannot simply get what they want.
thag21.1:63.4: _Saṅkheyyakāro_: “comprehensibility-maker”. _Saṅkheyya_ is always used in the sense of “calculable, comprehensible”, not “after comprehension”. The point is that, in line with the previous and succeeding verses, the Buddha explains things in a way that makes them clear. It’s a clever pair of lines, best served by sticking close to the literal form.
